NAME				Filippo Tatullo
NATIONALITY		Italian
ADDRESS 			4 , St Germains Villas,Silk Mills Path, London, SE137BG
PHONE NUMBER		+44 07597525072
EMAIL		 		filippo.tatullo@gmail.com
SKILLS
Immunology: flow cytometry and cell sorting (FACSVerse, FACSAria III, FACSCanto II, FACSCalibur), FlowJo, Diva and FACSuite, intracellular cytokine staining, PBMC isolation, MACS isolation, expansion of primary T cell, T cell epitope mapping, proliferation assay, B cell immortalization, ELISpot, ELISA, culture and differentiation of primary macrophages and dendritic cells, killing assay, cytokine bead array.
Cell biology: western blot, immunofluorescence, cell culture (mammalian and insect), siRNA, cytotoxicity assay.
Virology: plaque assay, plaque reduction neutralization test, focus forming assay, virus pr NAME				Filippo Tatullo
NATIONALITY		Italian
ADDRESS 			4 , St Germains Villas,Silk Mills Path, London, SE137BG
PHONE NUMBER		+44 07597525072
EMAIL		 		filippo.tatullo@gmail.com
SKILLS
Immunology: flow cytometry and cell sorting (FACSVerse, FACSAria III, FACSCanto II, FACSCalibur), FlowJo, Diva and FACSuite, intracellular cytokine staining, PBMC isolation, MACS isolation, expansion of primary T cell, T cell epitope mapping, proliferation assay, B cell immortalization, ELISpot, ELISA, culture and differentiation of primary macrophages and dendritic cells, killing assay, cytokine bead array.
Cell biology: western blot, immunofluorescence, cell culture (mammalian and insect), siRNA, cytotoxicity assay.
Virology: plaque assay, plaque reduction neutralization test, focus forming assay, virus propagation, experience working in a BSL 3 lab, EC50/90.
Molecular biology: cloning, nucleic acid extraction, PCR and RT-PCR, real time PCR, transcription in vitro.
IT and bioinformatics: NCBI database, viral pathogen database (ViPR), Immune epitope database (IEDB), Bioedit, Mega, designing of peptide library, imageJ, Graphpad Prism, Microsoft office.
Communication: I have presented my work in several meetings and seminars.
Team Work: I am always willing to support my team and I productively collaborated with Prof Paul Klenerman (Oxford University) and Dr Daniela Weiskopf (La Jolla Institute for Allergy and Immunology).
Problem Solving: I am able to deal with problems calmly and I enjoy overcoming challenges
Organization: I always spend some time planning my work in order to use my time in an efficient way and increase productivity
RESEARCH EXPERIENCE
August 2020- ongoing, hVIVO, London (UK)
Senior Development scientist
Manage development projects and a BSL3 laboratory compliant to GCP standards, implement new methodology and write SOP.
Manage clients helping them in study design and data analysis
Supervise and manage 3 junior development scientists
Training lab technicians and research scientists on new assays and data analysis and interpretation
November 2017- July 2020, hVIVO, London (UK):
Development scientist
Develop new assays on influenza viruses and respiratory syncytial virus (ELISA, focus forming assay, cell-based assays, plaque reduction assay)
Perform assay validations
Perform client oriented studies such as analysis of antiviral efficacy of compounds
October 2014 - October 2017, University of Liverpool (UK) and NIMHANS, Bangalore (India):
PhD student
Studying the T cell and antibody response to the live attenuated Japanese encephalitis virus vaccine in dengue exposed population (fully conducted in India).
Determining cross-reactivity of T cell response to Zika virus in volunteers previously exposed to other flavivirus infection (conducted at Liverpool and Oxford).
October 2013 - September 2014, University of Liverpool (UK):
MRes Clinical Science student
Investigating the in vitro immune response of human macrophages and dendritic cells to Semliki Forest virus infection.
Using a molecular assay to detect T cell response to Japanese encephalitis virus peptides in human blood.
Understanding the role of the deubiquitinase protein USP-10 in Semliki Forest virus replication in Hela cells.
July 2013 - August 2013, University of Innsbruck (Austria):
Visiting researcher
Identification of antifungal resistant strains of Aspergillus flavus isolated from patients.
January 2013 - September 2013, University of Verona (Italy):
Research assistant
Evaluation of commercial kit for diagnosis of Aspergillus sp.
Supporting diagnosis with sequencing of fungal isolates.
September 2012 â€“ December 2012, Laboratorio Analisi Colapinto, Manduria (Italy):
Biologist trainee
Performing routine serological tests
October 2010 - October 2011, University of Florence (Italy):
MSc student
Optimizing a High Resolution Melting technique to discriminate between Wild Type and Oseltamivir resistant influenza viruses.
EDUCATION
October 2014- December 2020: PhD Virology (University of Liverpool/NIMHANS, Bangalore)
October 2013 - September 2014: MRes Clinical Science (University of Liverpool)
April 2009 - October 2011: MSc in Medical biotechnology (University of Florence

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
